data.title: State Water Board Approves Emergency Curtailment Regulation for Scott and Shasta Rivers
data.excerpt: With climate change-induced drought causing critical low flows in the Scott and Shasta Rivers and threatening the survival of multiple fish species, the State Water Resources Control Board today approved an emergency curtailment regulation that includes measures to help maintain minimum flows to protect fish, ensure supplies for human health and livestock needs, and encourage … Read more
data.author: Chach Sikes

site_settings.site_description: Learn more about current conditions, the stateâ€™s response and informational resources available to the public.
